title: Double cab overturns near Monaragala town; Damages main water pipeline
byline: A double cab has reportedly veered off the road and toppled down from a bridge along the Monaragala–Pottuvil main road, near Monaragala town.

title: Minor flood warning issued for several low-lying areas of Mahaweli River Basin
byline: The Irrigation Department has issued a potential minor flood warning valid for the next 24 hours for several low-lying areas along the Mahaweli River Basin due to rainfall received since last night (21) in certain catchment areas.

title: Australia rejects report it is repatriating families of IS militants from Syrian camp
byline: Australia’s centre-left government on Sunday rejected a local media report that said it was working to repatriate Australians in a Syrian camp holding families of suspected Islamic State militants.

title: US President Donald Trump praises First Lady Melania Trump’s documentary, jokes about having “two stars” in one family
byline: US President Donald Trump praised First Lady Melania Trump’s documentary ‘Melania’ for its box office success, while joking about the challenges of having “two stars” in one family, according to People.

title: 29-year-old arrested with over 250g of heroin in Anuradhapura
byline: An individual has been arrested in Anuradhapura for possession of 255 grams of the narcotic substance heroin.

title: More details revealed on gunman arrested over Akuregoda double murder
byline: More details have been revealed by the police regarding the gunman arrested yesterday (21) in connection with the double homicide in Akuregoda, Thalangama.

title: 3 injured as train hits vehicle at Payagala; Coastal line trains delayed
byline: A Coastal Line train has collided with a cab at a railway crossing in Payagala, injuring three individuals.

title: 25-year-old woman arrested with ‘Ice’ in Mount Lavinia
byline: A 25-year-old woman has been arrested for possession of 110 grams of Crystal methamphetamine (commonly known as “Ice”) during a raid carried out in the William Place area of Mount Lavinia.

title: Heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island today
byline: Due to the low level atmospheric disturbance in the vicinity of Sri Lanka, showers or thundershowers will occur at most part of the island after 1.00 p.m, today (22), the Department of Meteorology said.

title: 21-year-old killed in road accident in Colombo–Kandy road
byline: A 21-year-old youth has died following a road accident in the Weweldeniya area along the Colombo–Kandy main road.

title: US Pacific Fleet Commander meets Dy Defence Minister, discuss shared security challenges
byline: The Commander of the U.S. Pacific Fleet, Admiral Stephen T. “Web” Koehler, who is on an official visit to Sri Lanka from 19 to 21 February, has met Sri Lanka’s Deputy Minister of Defence Major General (Retd) Aruna Jayasekara at his office in Colombo.

title: Trump says he will raise global tariff rate from 10% to 15%
byline: President Donald ‌Trump said on Saturday he will raise ‌to ⁠15% the temporary global ⁠tariff rate on imported goods imposed ‌after the U.S. Supreme Court ruled ‌against the tariffs he imposed ‌under an economic emergency law.

title: President to appoint expert committee to oversee education reforms – Minister
byline: Minister of Ports and Civil Aviation, Anura Karunatilaka, revealed that the President is set to appoint an expert committee to ensure the proper implementation of the education reform process.

title: Landslide ‘Red’ warnings issued to residents of several areas in four districts
byline: The National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) has issued ‘Level 3 (Red)’ landslide early warnings for several Divisional Secretariat Divisions (DSDs) across four districts due to prevailing heavy rainfall.

title: Sri Lankan man jailed for life in UK after killing wife in a car park
byline: A 37-year-old Sri Lankan man has been given a life sentence by a UK court after he stabbed his estranged wife to death in a car park after she began a relationship with a work colleague.

title: ChatGPT-maker OpenAI considered alerting Canadian police about school shooting suspect months ago
byline: ChatGPT-maker OpenAI said Friday it considered last year alerting Canadian police about the activities of a person who months later committed one of the worst school shootings in the country’s history.

title: Gold prices in Sri Lanka increase by Rs. 4,000
byline: Gold prices in Sri Lanka have risen by around Rs. 4,000, according to market data.

title: Somawathiya–Sungavila road temporarily closed to light vehicles due to flooding
byline: The Assistant Director of the Disaster Management Centre (DMC) for the Polonnaruwa District has reported that the Somawathiya–Sungavila Road has been inundated by approximately one foot of water as of this morning (21).

title: No one has the right to insult Buddhism or religious leaders - Sajith
byline: Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa stated that no individual has the right to insult Buddhism or any religious leaders.

title: Nasa targets early March to send humans back around the Moon
byline: Nasa is targeting early March to launch a crew around the Moon for the first time in more than 50 years, in what would be humankind’s furthest trip into space.

title: Dondra shooting victim succumbs to injuries
byline: The fish trader who was shot and injured near a supermarket in Dondra has succumbed to his injuries on admission to hospital, police said.

title: Landslide warnings issued for multiple areas in two districts extended
byline: The National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) has extended the early landslide warnings previously issued for several areas in the Nuwara Eliya District and Badulla District.

title: Person injured in shooting incident near supermarket in Dondra
byline: A person has reportedly been shot and injured near a supermarket at Dondra, within the Gandara police division, a short while ago.

title: Tamil Nadu fishermen go on day-long strike against arrests by Sri Lankan Navy
byline: Condemning the recent arrest of Tamil Nadu fishermen by Sri Lankan Navy personnel, members of various fishermen associations in Rameswaram refrained from venturing into the sea for fishing activities on Saturday (21), The Hindu reported.

title: One of the gunmen in Akuregoda double murder arrested
byline: One of the two gunmen involved in the recent shooting and killing of a lawyer and his wife at Akuregoda has been arrested by the police.

title: 584 arrested in island-wide anti-drug raids yesterday: Police
byline: As part of the ongoing island-wide crime and drug prevention programme conducted by Sri Lanka Police, a total of 29,165 individuals were screened within yesterday (20) alone.

title: PUCSL to begin public consultations on proposed electricity tariff hike from Feb. 25
byline: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) has announced that public consultation sessions on the proposal submitted by the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) to revise electricity tariffs for the second quarter of 2026 will commence on February 25.

title: Dondra shooting: More details revealed, suspects’ vehicle found abandoned
byline: It has been revealed that the fatal shooting of a fish trader in Dondra, Matara, this afternoon occurred despite the victim being under police protection due to established threats to his life.

title: Weather advisory issued for heavy rainfall in several areas
byline: An ‘Amber’ advisory has been issued by the Department of Meteorology for heavy rainfall in the Central, Uva and Sabaragamuwa provinces, as well as in the Ampara, Batticaloa and Polonnaruwa districts.

title: US-donated 4th Coast Guard Cutter embarks on historic voyage to join Sri Lanka Navy fleet
byline: In a significant boost to regional maritime security, the former U.S. Coast Guard Cutter DECISIVE (Ex-USCGC DECISIVE) officially departed Baltimore on Friday, beginning a historic journey to join the Sri Lanka Navy (SLN) fleet.

title: Vehicles entering and exiting expressway at Dodangoda subjected to police inspections
byline: Vehicles entering and exiting the Southern Expressway from the Dodangoda entry point in Kalutara were subjected to a special inspection by the police last night (20).

title: Trump says he is considering limited military strike on Iran
byline: US President Donald Trump has said he is considering a limited military strike on Iran in order to pressure its leaders to agree a deal to curb the nuclear programme.

title: British government considers removing Andrew from royal line of succession
byline: The British government is considering introducing legislation to remove Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor from the line of royal succession.

title: Suspect arrested with ‘Ice’ worth over Rs. 800,000 in Mount Lavinia
byline: A suspect was arrested in the Soysapura area of Mount Lavinia while transporting over Rs. 800,000 worth of crystal methamphetamine (“Ice”) on a motorcycle.

title: Landslide ‘Red’ warnings issued for four districts extended
byline: The National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) has extended ‘Level 3 (Red)’ landslide warnings issued to several Divisional Secretariat Divisions (DSDs) across four districts due to prevailing heavy rainfall.

title: Police uncover key details over Akuregoda double murder
byline: Police have uncovered significant information from the suspects arrested in connection with the fatal shooting of a lawyer and his wife at a parking lot of a supermarket in Akuregoda on February 13.

title: MRI scans show exercise can make the brain look younger: Study
byline: New research suggests that regular aerobic exercise can help keep your brain biologically younger. Adults who exercised regularly for a year showed brains that appeared nearly a year younger than those who didn’t change their habits.

title: Over 200mm rainfall reported in several areas; Red evacuation warnings issued to 15 DS divisions
byline: Heavy showers exceeding 200mm have been recorded in several parts of the island, the National Building Research Organisation (NBRO) said.

title: Russia hits Ukraine energy infrastructure with major missile, drone strikes, Kyiv says
byline: Russia attacked Ukraine with dozens of strike drones and ballistic and cruise missiles, focusing on energy infrastructure, the Ukrainian military and local officials said on Sunday.

title: Duo arrested with Kendu leaves, cigarettes and agrochemicals off Thoduwawa Coast
byline: Two individuals have been arrested by the Sri Lanka Coast Guard for possessing 25 sacks containing 992 kilograms and 800 grams of Kendu leaves, 140,000 sticks of foreign-made cigarettes and a consignment of agrochemicals along with a dinghy boat.

title: Two individuals confirmed dead after Payagala train-cab accident
byline: At least two individuals have been confirmed dead after a train plying along the coastal line collided with a cab at a railway crossing in Payagala this morning (22), police stated.

title: Eheliyagoda records highest rainfall; Thundershowers likely this afternoon
byline: Eheliyagoda in Ratnapura received 171mm of rain, the highest rainfall within the past 24 hours, according to the Department of Meteorology.

title: MP Namal Rajapaksa and Lankan delegation in London for several engagements
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) Member of Parliament Namal Rajapaksa has landed in the United Kingdom to take part in several events in the next few days.

title: PM Modi flags off India’s fastest metro and Namo Bharat train in Meerut
byline: Prime Minister Narendra Modi launched Meerut’s metro service and dedicated the full 82-km Delhi-Meerut rapid rail corridor to the nation. With an operational speed of 120 kmph, the Meerut Metro becomes the fastest system in India. The integrated network is expected to reduce travel time between Delhi and Meerut to around 55 minutes.

title: Govt decides to conduct comprehensive review of several laws
byline: The government has announced a comprehensive review of long-standing laws across multiple sectors, with plans to amend outdated statutes and regulations to better align with present-day needs.

title: Sri Lanka rated most affordable destination for foreign retirees in 2026
byline: Sri Lanka has been rated the most affordable destination for foreign nationals to retire in 2026, according to the International Living 2026 Annual Global Retirement Index.

title: Pakistan launches strikes on Afghanistan, with Taliban saying dozens killed
byline: Pakistan has carried out multiple overnight air strikes on Afghanistan, which the Taliban has said killed and wounded dozens of people, including women and children.

title: One dead, two injured in Dadalla accident
byline: A 24-year-old youth has been killed and two others sustained serious injuries in a road accident that occurred in the early hours of today (22) in Dadalla, Galle.

title: 90-day detention order issued to question suspected gunman in Akuregoda double murder
byline: A 90-day detention order has been obtained to question the suspected gunman arrested in connection with the killing of a lawyer and his wife in Akuregoda, the Homagama Divisional Crime Investigation Bureau said.

title: Advisory issued for low pressure area over southwest Bay of Bengal
byline: The atmospheric disturbance that prevailed over the Bay of Bengal has developed into a low pressure area and is currently located to the northeast of Sri Lanka, the Department of Meteorology stated.

title: Minor flooding reported on Polonnaruwa–Batticaloa Road
byline: Sections of the Polonnaruwa–Batticaloa main road have been submerged owing to rise in water levels of the Mahaweli River following heavy showers in upper catchment areas.

title: Prevailing rainy conditions expected to gradually decrease
byline: The prevailing rainy conditions are expected to gradually decrease with the low-pressure area over the southwest Bay of Bengal moving away from the island, according to the Department of Meteorology.

title: No flooding in Nuwara Eliya Town; Social media claims false – District Secretary
byline: Reports circulating on social media claiming that Nuwara Eliya town has been submerged are incorrect, District Secretary Thushari Tennakoon said.

title: Circular issued to ensure pension entitlements for officers appointed to public service after Jan. 2016
byline: Steps have been taken by the Ministry of Public Administration to amend letters of appointment regarding pension entitlements for officers appointed to the public service on or after January 1, 2016.

title: Fresh landslide threat in Aranayaka following heavy rains
byline: Fresh landslide risks have emerged in Aranayaka, which was previously devastated by landslides triggered by Cyclone Ditwah, following heavy rains yesterday (21).

title: US ambassador’s Israel comments condemned by Arab and Muslim nations
byline: Arab and Muslim governments have condemned remarks made by the US Ambassador to Israel, Mike Huckabee, who suggested Israel would be justified in taking over a vast stretch of the Middle East on Biblical grounds.

title: Litro gas shipment arrives; two more vessels expected shortly
byline: A vessel carrying 3,900 metric tonnes of LP gas arrived in the country today (22), according to Litro Gas Lanka Ltd.

title: Lawyer arrested with ‘Ice’ in Keselwatta remanded
byline: A lawyer who was arrested by the Keselwatta Police while allegedly using crystal methamphetamine (commonly known as “Ice”) in a dark and abandoned building in the Sanchiarachchi Watta area of Keselwatta, has been remanded until February 26 after being produced before the Maligakanda Magistrate’s Court.

title: Sangakkara critical of Sri Lankan batters’ approach after defeat to England
byline: Failure to read the game situation and the Pallekelle pitch resulted in Sri Lanka losing to England by 51 runs in the Super Eight round fixture of the 2026 T20 World Cup in Kandy today, according to former captain Kumar Sangakkara.

title: Armed man shot and killed by US Secret Service after entering perimeter at Trump’s Mar-a-Lago
byline: An armed man drove into the secure perimeter of Mar-a-Lago, President Donald Trump’s resort in Palm Beach, Florida, as another vehicle was exiting before being shot and killed early Sunday morning, according to a spokesman for the U.S. Secret Service.
